title: Poster, Greater New Haven Youth Ensemble- Yale Bach Society, ca. 1973
title_raw: Greater New Haven Youth Ensemble- Yale Bach Society
inscribed:
Imprinted upper right, in red, the name 'Bach' in white throughout: GREATER NEW HAVEN YOUTH ENSEMBLE / YALE BACH SOCIETY / Chamber Orchestra and Chorus  / ORCHESTRAL GROUP And William Harwood, Conductor / Peter Frewen, guest conductor.
Upper left in red: An Evening if Music with the Family Bach / C.P.E.Bach / Orchestral Symphony No 3 in F / J.C. Bach / Sinfonia Concertante / J.S. Bach / Cantata No 182 / Cantata 211 (Kaffee) / P.D.Q. Bach / Two Madrigals
Below  the image right center: Soloists  Benjamin DeLoache, baritone / Blanche Porto, alto / Cayce Blanchard, soprano / Jack Litten, tenor / Jerome Tureck, bass / Sherill Roberts, violin cello / Robert Eshbach, violin / Robert Hart, flute / James Ruon, oboe
At lower right in red and white: Friday April 13 / 8:30 pm / Pierson Dining Hall / Free
provenance: From the collection of Dan Friedman
description: LArge red leter "B" dominatesa cool gray background.  Surrounding the letter, red and white san serif text giving details of the various programs and the musical soloists.

tombstone.epitaph: Poster, Greater New Haven Youth Ensemble- Yale Bach Society, ca. 1973. screenprint on white wove paper. Gift of Ken Friedman. 1997-19-267.
